title: pca_in_one
text: data feature value matrix data frame format, rows represent samples columns represent feature values. contain numeric feature values. Additionally, row names need provided facilitate merging sample data frame plotting purposes.

title: pca_in_one
text: sample sample information matrix, first column contains sample names. default column name sample, specific requirements names columns.
code: #   sample species # 1      1  setosa # 2      2  setosa # 3      3  setosa # 4      4  setosa # 5      5  setosa # 6      6  setosa

title: pca_in_one
text: output list containing: result.pca: output FactoMineR::PCA, can called directly. plot.pca: plotting results, defaulting PC1 PC2. output ggplot object, can fine-tuned using ggplot2. point.data: data used plotting, users can call plots export use software. eigenvalue.pca: explained variance principal components, starting PC1 default.
code: # devtools::install_github("lixiang117423/biohelpers")  library(tidyverse) library(biohelpers)  data <- iris[, 1:4]  sample <- iris$Species %>%   as.data.frame() %>%   rownames_to_column(var = "sample") %>%   set_names(c("sample", "species"))  pca_in_one(data, sample) -> result.pca

text: Principal Component Analysis（PCA） Correlation Calculation Linear Regression Plotting Identification Outliers ggplot2 theme reorder heatmap

title: Convenience Functions for Biological Data Processing

what: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) and return the results. — PCA
title: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) and return the results. — PCA
text: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) return results.

title: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) and return the results. — PCA
code: PCA(   data,   sample,   pca.num = 5,   plot = TRUE,   x = "pc1",   y = "pc2",   color = "species",   shape = "species" )

title: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) and return the results. — PCA
text: data data frame rows samples columns indicators. sample data frame containing sample information, one column sample names match @param data description, without need row names. pca.num returned results include number principal components, default value 10. plot Whether plot, default draw scatter plot. plotted graph ggplot2 object, can customized enhanced using ggplot2. x principal component use X-axis, default pc1. y principal component use Y-axis, default pc2. color grouping information use color points, default species. shape grouping information use shape points, default species.

title: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) and return the results. — PCA
text: list containing calculation results, scree plot, scatter plot, COS2 plot.

title: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) and return the results. — PCA
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(tibble) library(magrittr)  data <- iris[, 1:4] sample <- iris$Species %>%   as.data.frame() %>%   rownames_to_column(var = "sample") %>%   set_names(c("sample", "species"))  PCA(data, sample) -> result.pca

title: Perform principal coordinate analysis (PCoA). — PCoA
code: PCoA(   data,   sample,   method = "bray",   x = "PCo1",   y = "PCo2",   size = 2,   color = "group",   alpha = 1 )

title: Perform principal coordinate analysis (PCoA). — PCoA
text: data Feature table, rows representing samples columns representing feature values, OTUs. sample Sample table, first column containing sample names. specific requirements names subsequent columns, sample names must match feature table. method method calculating distances vegan::vegdist() defaulted Bray-Curtis. x principal coordinate used X-axis plot defaulted PCo1. y principal coordinate used y-axis plot defaulted PCo2. size size point. color Column names sample data frame used coloring points. alpha alpha point.

title: Perform principal coordinate analysis (PCoA). — PCoA
text: list containing data frame ggplot2 object.

title: Perform principal coordinate analysis (PCoA). — PCoA
code: library(dplyr) library(biohelpers)  data(df.pcoa.otu) data(df.pcoa.sample)  PCoA(data = df.pcoa.otu, sample = df.pcoa.sample) -> pcoa.res #> Joining with `by = join_by(sample)`

what: biohelpers: Convenience Functions for Biological Data Processing — biohelpers-package
title: biohelpers: Convenience Functions for Biological Data Processing — biohelpers-package
biohelpers: Convenience Functions for Biological Data Processing — biohelpers-package
Title — call_DAMs_DESeq2
code: call_DAMs_DESeq2(   data,   sample,   group = "group",   log2FoldChange = 1,   padj = 0.05 )

title: Title — call_DAMs_DESeq2
text: data Expression matrix must integers, rows representing gene names columns representing sample names. sample Sample information table, rows representing sample names. group Grouping information samples, column names @param sample table, must factors. log2FoldChange threshold absolute value log2FoldChange set 1 default. padj threshold adjusted p-value set 0.05 default.

title: Title — call_DAMs_DESeq2
code: library(biohelpers)  data(df.pcoa.otu) data(df.pcoa.sample)  call_DAMs_DESeq2(t(df.pcoa.otu), df.pcoa.sample) -> dems.res #> converting counts to integer mode #> Warning: some variables in design formula are characters, converting to factors #> estimating size factors #> estimating dispersions #> gene-wise dispersion estimates #> mean-dispersion relationship #> final dispersion estimates #> fitting model and testing

what: Identifying differential abundance microbiomes using LEfSe. — call_DAMs_LEfSe
title: Identifying differential abundance microbiomes using LEfSe. — call_DAMs_LEfSe
text: Identifying differential abundance microbiomes using LEfSe.

title: Identifying differential abundance microbiomes using LEfSe. — call_DAMs_LEfSe
code: call_DAMs_LEfSe(   data,   sample,   groupCol = "group",   kruskal.threshold = 0.05,   wilcox.threshold = 0.05,   lda.threshold = 1 )

title: Identifying differential abundance microbiomes using LEfSe. — call_DAMs_LEfSe
text: data Feature table, rows representing feature values columns representing sample names. sample Sample table, rows representing sample name columns representing group information. groupCol column name grouping information located, default 'group'. kruskal.threshold threshold Kruskal test, default 0.05. wilcox.threshold threshold Wilcox test, default 0.05. lda.threshold threshold LDA test, default 1.

title: Identifying differential abundance microbiomes using LEfSe. — call_DAMs_LEfSe
Identifying differential abundance microbiomes using LEfSe. — call_DAMs_LEfSe
code: library(biohelpers) library(dplyr)  data(df.call_DAMs_LEfSe.otu) data(df.call_DAMs_LEfSe.sample)  call_DAMs_LEfSe(df.call_DAMs_LEfSe.otu, df.call_DAMs_LEfSe.sample) -> lefse.result #> Warning: The 'groupCol' argument is deprecated, use 'classCol' instead. #> Warning: Convert counts to relative abundances with 'relativeAb()' #> The outcome variable is specified as 'group' and the reference category is 'CK'. #>  See `?factor` or `?relevel` to change the reference category. #> Warning: Variables in the input are collinear. Try only with the terminal nodes using `get_terminal_nodes` function

what: Identifying Differentially Expressed Genes Using DESeq2 — call_DEGs_DESeq2
title: Identifying Differentially Expressed Genes Using DESeq2 — call_DEGs_DESeq2
text: Identifying Differentially Expressed Genes Using DESeq2

title: Identifying Differentially Expressed Genes Using DESeq2 — call_DEGs_DESeq2
code: call_DEGs_DESeq2(data, sample, group, log2FoldChange = 1, padj = 0.05)

title: Identifying Differentially Expressed Genes Using DESeq2 — call_DEGs_DESeq2
text: data Expression matrix must integers, rows representing gene names columns representing sample names. sample Sample information table, rows representing sample names. group Grouping information samples, column names @param sample table, must factors. log2FoldChange threshold absolute value log2FoldChange set 1 default. padj threshold adjusted p-value set 0.05 default.

title: Identifying Differentially Expressed Genes Using DESeq2 — call_DEGs_DESeq2
Identifying Differentially Expressed Genes Using DESeq2 — call_DEGs_DESeq2
code: library(dplyr) library(biohelpers)  data(df.rnaseq.gene) data(df.rnaseq.sample) call_DEGs_DESeq2(data = df.rnaseq.gene,                   sample = df.rnaseq.sample,                   group = "group") -> degs #> converting counts to integer mode #> estimating size factors #> estimating dispersions #> gene-wise dispersion estimates #> mean-dispersion relationship #> -- note: fitType='parametric', but the dispersion trend was not well captured by the #>    function: y = a/x + b, and a local regression fit was automatically substituted. #>    specify fitType='local' or 'mean' to avoid this message next time. #> final dispersion estimates #> fitting model and testing

what: Calculate Correlation, Return Correlation Results. — cor_and_plot
title: Calculate Correlation, Return Correlation Results. — cor_and_plot
Calculate Correlation, Return Correlation Results. — cor_and_plot
code: cor_and_plot(   data.1,   data.2 = NULL,   method = "pearson",   cor = 0.6,   pvalue = 0.05 )

title: Calculate Correlation, Return Correlation Results. — cor_and_plot
text: data.1 First Data Frame. column represents feature value. data.2 Second Data Frame. column represents feature value. method three options calculating correlation: `pearson`, `kendall`,`spearman`, `pearson` default. cor Correlation threshold, default 0.5. pvalue P-value threshold, default 0.05.

title: Calculate Correlation, Return Correlation Results. — cor_and_plot
Calculate Correlation, Return Correlation Results. — cor_and_plot
code: library(biohelpers)  x <- iris[, 1:4] y <- iris[, 1:4]  cor_and_plot(data.1 = x, data.2 = y) -> result.cor #> Joining with `by = join_by(from, to)`

what: Perform GO enrichment analysis of differentially expressed genes. — enrich_GO
title: Perform GO enrichment analysis of differentially expressed genes. — enrich_GO
text: Perform GO enrichment analysis differentially expressed genes.

title: Perform GO enrichment analysis of differentially expressed genes. — enrich_GO
code: enrich_GO(gene, go.db, pAdjustMethod = "BH", p.adjust = 0.05)

title: Perform GO enrichment analysis of differentially expressed genes. — enrich_GO
text: gene names differentially expressed genes vector. go.db GO database used GO enrichment analysis needs data frame format must contain following columns: gene, go.id, go.term. go.ontology column optional. pAdjustMethod Methods adjusting p-values can selected "holm", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "", "fdr", "none", "BH" default. p.adjust Threshold adjusted P value.

title: Perform GO enrichment analysis of differentially expressed genes. — enrich_GO
Perform GO enrichment analysis of differentially expressed genes. — enrich_GO
code: library(biohelpers)  data(df.rnaseq.go) data(df.rnaseq.degs)  enrich_GO(gene = df.rnaseq.degs$gene, go.db = df.rnaseq.go) -> go.res

what: Perform KEGG enrichment analysis of differentially expressed genes. — enrich_KEGG
title: Perform KEGG enrichment analysis of differentially expressed genes. — enrich_KEGG
text: Perform KEGG enrichment analysis differentially expressed genes.

title: Perform KEGG enrichment analysis of differentially expressed genes. — enrich_KEGG
code: enrich_KEGG(gene, kegg.db, pAdjustMethod = "BH", p.adjust = 0.05)

title: Perform KEGG enrichment analysis of differentially expressed genes. — enrich_KEGG
text: gene names differentially expressed genes vector. kegg.db KEGG database used KEGG enrichment analysis needs data frame format must contain following columns: gene, kegg.id, kegg.term. kegg.ontology column optional. pAdjustMethod Methods adjusting p-values can selected "holm", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "", "fdr", "none", "BH" default. p.adjust Threshold adjusted P value.

title: Perform KEGG enrichment analysis of differentially expressed genes. — enrich_KEGG
Perform KEGG enrichment analysis of differentially expressed genes. — enrich_KEGG
code: library(biohelpers)  data(df.rnaseq.kegg) data(df.rnaseq.degs)  enrich_KEGG(gene = df.rnaseq.degs$gene, kegg.db = df.rnaseq.kegg) -> kegg.res

title: Identification of Outliers. — find_outliner
code: find_outliner(x)

title: Identification of Outliers. — find_outliner
code: library(dplyr) library(biohelpers)  data(iris)  iris %>%   dplyr::group_by(Species) %>%   dplyr::mutate(is.out = find_outliner(Sepal.Length)) %>%   dplyr::ungroup() -> result.find_outlinr

text: "Perform simple linear regression calculations return corresponding plot."

code: lm_and_plot(data, x, y, group, color)

text: data input data frame contains information @param x, @param y, @param group, @param color. x Independent variable, also used X-axis plot. y Dependent variable, also used Y-axis plot. group column name used differentiate groups, also serves grouping information batch calculations regression coefficients P-values. color color scatter plot graph.
list containing data frame plot, data frame includes regression coefficients P-values, plot scatter plot.

code: library(biohelpers)  df <- iris lm_and_plot(   data = df,   x = "Sepal.Length",   y = "Sepal.Width",   group = "Species",   color = "Species" ) -> results.lm

title: ggplot2 plotting theme. — plot_theme
code: plot_theme(   base.size = 10,   strip.text.italic = FALSE,   show.minor.tricks.x = FALSE,   show.minor.tricks.y = TRUE )

title: ggplot2 plotting theme. — plot_theme
text: base.size Default font size. strip.text.italic Whether font italic displayed groups. show.minor.tricks.x Whether display minor ticks X-axis. show.minor.tricks.y Whether display minor ticks y-axis.

title: ggplot2 plotting theme. — plot_theme
code: library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(biohelpers)  data(iris)  iris %>%   ggplot(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width)) +   geom_point() +   plot_theme()

title: Create a volcano plot. — plot_volcano
code: plot_volcano(   data,   x = "log2FoldChange",   y = "padj",   size = "baseMean",   color = "group",   xintercept.abs = 1,   yintercept = 0.05 )

title: Create a volcano plot. — plot_volcano
text: data data frame used create scatter plot typically output DESeq2, specifically output call_DEGs_DESeq2. x X axis. y Y axis. size Column name used map size points, default baseMean. color Column name used map color points. xintercept.abs Intercept X axes. usually log2FoldChange, includes positive negative values. yintercept Intercept Y axes. usually -log10(padj).

title: Create a volcano plot. — plot_volcano
code: library(biohelpers)  data(df.rnaseq.plot_volcano)  plot_volcano(data = df.rnaseq.plot_volcano) -> p

title: Title — reorder2heatmap
code: reorder2heatmap(data, col, row, value)

title: Title — reorder2heatmap
text: data Input data data frame format, specifically long data format, tidyr format. col Typically, column name sample names located. row Typically, column name feature names located. value column name numerical values needed plotting heatmap located.

title: Title — reorder2heatmap
code: library(dplyr) library(biohelpers)  data(df.reorder2heatmap)  reorder2heatmap(   data = df.reorder2heatmap,   col = "sample",   row = "meta",   value = "value" ) -> df.reorder

title: Test data. — test_data
code: test_data

title: Test data. — test_data
text: ## `test_data` data frame 7,240 rows 60 columns: Sepal.Length length sepal Sepal.Width width sepal Petal.Length length petal Petal.Width width petal Species species group

what: Calculate the top ten microorganisms by abundance at different taxonomic levels. — top_10
title: Calculate the top ten microorganisms by abundance at different taxonomic levels. — top_10
text: Calculate top ten microorganisms abundance different taxonomic levels.

title: Calculate the top ten microorganisms by abundance at different taxonomic levels. — top_10
code: top_10(   data,   sample,   taxo,   which = "phylum",   by = "sum",   method = "wilcox",   ref = "CK",   pvalue = 0.05 )

title: Calculate the top ten microorganisms by abundance at different taxonomic levels. — top_10
text: data Feature table, OTU abundance information, rows represent samples columns represent feature values. sample Sample table, first column sample name, second column onwards contain grouping information, must column named 'group'. taxo Classification information, classification information OTUs. classification information analyze plot, 'phylum' default. Calculate Top 10 summation averaging, 'sum' default. method Statistical analysis method, 'wilcox' (Wilcox test) default. ref name control group used statistical analysis, 'CK' default. pvalue Threshold p-value, default 0.05.

title: Calculate the top ten microorganisms by abundance at different taxonomic levels. — top_10
text: list containing data frame ggplot2 object.

title: Calculate the top ten microorganisms by abundance at different taxonomic levels. — top_10
code: library(dplyr) library(biohelpers)  data(df.top10.otu) data(df.top10.sample) data(df.top10.class)  top_10(df.top10.otu, df.top10.sample, df.top10.class) -> top10.res #> Joining with `by = join_by(sample)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(OTU)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(sample)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(taxo)`
